title: Ferrari to raise $900m in stock market flotation

Sat, Oct 10, 2015, 01:32 BST - UK Markets closed Ferrari to raise $900m in stock market flotation By Reuters | Telegraph – 43 minutes ago 0.00 
Italian sports car maker expects to list on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol 'RACE' 
Ferrari 's stock market flotation is expected to raise as much as $900m, valuing the Italian car maker at $9.92bn. 
The US IPO of 17.2m shares - at the planned price range of $48 to $52 per share - is roughly 9pc of parent company Fiat (Hanover: FIA1.HA - news ) Chrysler Automobiles ' stake. 
FCA, which owns around 90pc of Ferrari, is planning to distribute the rest of its stake to its shareholders. 
The Italian sports car maker, famous for its "prancing horse" logo and its Formula One racing team, expects to list on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "RACE". 
FCA said it expects Ferrari to go public by mid-October. 
Even (Taiwan OTC: 6436.TWO - news ) after the spin-off, Piero Ferrari, vice-chairman and son of founder Enzo, will continue to hold a 10pc stake in the company. 
Piero Ferrari and Fiat's founding Agnelli family, through their holding company Exor, could end up with a voting power of around 50pc, enabling them to thwart any unwanted takeover bid. Exor will hold about 23.6pc of Ferrari's shares on completion of the separation, expected to occur by early 2016. 
Ferrari expects to report revenue of about €720m to €730m for the three months ended September 30, an increase of 9pc to 10pc from a year earlier. 
The company expects adjusted EBITDA to go up 19pc to 22pc to €210m to €215m. 
Ferrari added Allen & Co, BNP Paribas (Xetra: 887771 - news ) , JP Morgan and Mediobanca (Milan: MB.MI - news ) to its list of underwriters that includes Banco Santander (EUREX: 817651.EX - news ) , BofA Merrill Lynch and UBS Investment Bank.
